page.title: 22Cammel Lairds Shipyard
page.content: Cammel Lairds shipyard still survives an a major employer in the area. It mainly works at ship repair / annual servicing inspections for Irish Sea ferries / roll on roll off transporters. There are Royal Navy auxiliary supply vessels undergoing refits. Sometimes two together being worked on. It has been given a new lease of life as a construction yard with the contract to build the flight decks for the new Royal Navy aircraft carriers. They have had to install new lifting overhead cranes in the construction hall to cope with the massive tonnage of the deck beams and deck sections.
